intro: Helicteres roxburghii, commonly known as the Indian senna, is a deciduous shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
